elements.name: A7_context
elements.title: Task A7
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: Brantley's confidence issues have really impacted his performance in a negative way. He's a new member of the team, so I'll cut him some slack. But he's constantly questioning whether he's approaching his assignments in the right way. Moreover his self-doubt impacts the impression that he gives to clients, so I'm always nervous to have him with me in meetings. I think, Brantley has a ton of room to grow.

Green Elephant
Brantley's lack of confidence negatively impacts his performance and client interactions. As a new team member, he has significant potential for growth.


Red Panda
Brantley: Confidence issues negatively impact performance & client impression. New, so given slack, but significant room to grow.


Blue Whale
Brantley's new, but his self-doubt negatively impacts his performance and client interactions. He needs to build confidence to improve.


Golden Fish
Brantley’s confidence issues are negatively affecting his performance and client interactions. As a new team member, he shows potential, but his self-doubt hinders progress and raises concerns in meetings. He has significant room to grow.

elements.name: A11_context
elements.title: Task A11
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: Alina's work for this project was not as good as her previous work, however, it is still very much usable. Alina's work in the past has been remarkable- she pays close attention to detail, triple checks her work, and always makes sure her work is as clear and concise as it can be. I always look forward to working with Alina, because her work is, as I stated before, quite well put together.

Blue Whale
While usable, Alina's recent work was not up to her usual remarkable standard. She is typically a detail-oriented and highly-valued collaborator.


Red Panda
Alina: Current project work usable but not as good as remarkable past work (detail-oriented, clear, concise). Always look forward to working with her.


Green Elephant
Alina's recent work, while usable, wasn't her usual remarkable standard. She typically excels in detail, accuracy, and clarity. Her past work is consistently well-regarded.


Golden Fish
Alina's current work, while not up to her usual exceptional standard, remains usable. Her past performance has been outstanding—detailed, thorough, and clear. She consistently delivers high-quality work, and collaborating with her is always a pleasure.

elements.title: Please select the correct statement
elements.description: ORIGINAL: The sun appears to rise each morning from the eastern horizon before setting in the west

elements.name: A3_context
elements.title: Task A3
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: Wade Stanley is repeatedly late, hostile, and under-performing—disciplinary action now likely.

Golden Fish
Wade, your repeated lateness, hostile behavior, and continued under-performance are unacceptable and violate our standards. This formal warning outlines that disciplinary action is now the immediate next step.


Red Panda
Wade, your repeated tardiness, displays of hostility, and sustained under-performance are serious concerns. This behavior is unacceptable and negatively impacts the team. Immediate and sustained correction is required. Formal disciplinary action is now likely unless significant improvement is demonstrated without delay.


Green Elephant
Wade's consistent tardiness significantly impacts team productivity and meeting schedules. His interactions have frequently been perceived as uncooperative, creating a challenging team dynamic. Furthermore, his work output consistently falls below expected standards. These ongoing issues necessitate immediate improvement, and disciplinary action is now being considered to address these serious concerns.


Blue Whale
Wade Stanley has consistently demonstrated poor punctuality, unprofessional behavior, and subpar performance. Despite previous feedback, there has been no improvement. Disciplinary action is now likely to address these ongoing concerns and uphold team standards.

elements.name: A6_context
elements.title: Task A6
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: Frederick Rogers is a role-model performer who mentors others and shows strong leadership potential.

Blue Whale
Frederick, you are a role-model performer whose contributions consistently exceed expectations. Your willingness to mentor others is invaluable, and you clearly demonstrate strong leadership potential. Let's discuss a formal leadership track.


Golden Fish
Frederick, you are a true role-model performer. Beyond your own excellent results, your willingness to mentor colleagues and demonstrate leadership potential is highly valued. Keep up the outstanding work; you are a significant asset to the team and positioned for greater responsibility.


Green Elephant
Frederick consistently performs at an exceptionally high level, serving as a role model for his peers. He actively mentors colleagues, sharing his expertise and fostering team growth. His proactive approach and natural ability to guide demonstrate significant leadership potential, making him a valuable asset to the team.


Red Panda
Frederick Rogers consistently demonstrates exceptional performance and serves as a role model for his peers. He actively mentors colleagues, fosters collaboration, and exhibits strong leadership potential through his initiative and commitment to team success.

elements.name: A13_context
elements.title: Task A13
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: Elliot is fairly effective at managing his workload. He has been a consistent team member. Though, he has not sought help to achieve better results. He needs initiative to become one of our rising stars.

Red Panda
Elliot is a steady and reliable contributor whose work is effective. This feedback implies that to advance and be seen as a "rising star," he must demonstrate more proactivity. Elliot can grow by identifying a process improvement to propose and by asking his manager for more challenging assignments.


Golden Fish
The feedback means Elliot consistently delivers work but hasn't proactively sought help for improvement. This implies reliability is recognized, yet initiative is needed to advance. To grow, Elliot should: 1) Schedule monthly check-ins with his manager to discuss goals, 2) Identify one skill to develop next quarter and request resources, 3) Propose one small process improvement idea by month-end.


Blue Whale
Elliot, your manager sees you as a consistent and effective team member who manages his workload well. However, they've noticed you haven't proactively sought help to improve your results, which is holding you back from being a "rising star." To address this, Elliot should: 1) Identify specific areas for improvement in his work. 2) Schedule a meeting with his manager to discuss these areas and ask for guidance or resources. 3) Proactively seek feedback from peers or mentors on how to enhance his contributions. 4) Take initiative on a new project or responsibility that aligns with his growth goals.


Green Elephant
Elliot consistently manages his workload and contributes reliably to the team, showing solid performance. However, to grow into a rising star, he needs to proactively seek support and opportunities for improvement. This feedback suggests potential for advancement if initiative is strengthened. Elliot should: (1) schedule regular check-ins with his manager to discuss goals, (2) ask for feedback proactively, (3) identify one process to improve and propose a solution, and (4) collaborate more with high-performing peers to learn new approaches.

elements.name: A17_context
elements.title: Task A17
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: Dean has contributed heavily to the project in the past quarter. He has led the team charts in task completion. However, he has struggled with taking up responsibilities to deliver complex tasks. He also does not handle high pressure situations well.

Blue Whale
Dean is a top contributor in task completion but struggles with complex work and high-pressure situations, limiting his growth into senior roles. He can improve by asking to partner with a senior colleague on a complex project and by breaking down difficult tasks into smaller, more manageable parts.


Golden Fish
The feedback means Dean excels in task volume but struggles with complex or high-pressure responsibilities. This indicates high output but risks in scaling his role. Dean should: 1) Partner with a senior colleague on one complex task monthly, 2) Break high-pressure goals into smaller steps, 3) Practice stress-management techniques before deadlines.


Green Elephant
Dean, your manager recognizes your significant contributions and high task completion rate this quarter, which is commendable. However, the feedback indicates a need for growth in handling complex tasks and performing under pressure. This suggests that while you excel at individual contributions, there's an opportunity to develop your capacity for more challenging, high-stakes assignments. To address this, Dean should proactively seek opportunities to shadow colleagues on complex tasks, practice stress management techniques, and communicate openly with his manager about his development goals and willingness to take on new challenges.


Red Panda
Dean has been a top performer in task completion and has significantly contributed to the project, showing strong initiative and reliability in managing workloads. However, he faces challenges with complex responsibilities and maintaining composure under pressure, which may limit growth into higher-leadership roles. To grow, Dean should seek mentorship from senior team members on navigating complexity, practice structured problem-solving techniques, proactively communicate early when feeling overwhelmed, and take on stretch assignments in a supported environment to build confidence and resilience.
